title: Apple Is the World's First $3 Trillion Company
description: The iPhone’s strength has helped to offset supply chain challenges, a global pandemic and recessionary fears.

title: Meta Asked by Senators to Detail Efforts to Prevent Sharing of Child Sexual-Abuse Material
description: Members of the Senate Judiciary Committee sent a letter to Meta citing WSJ reporting about Instagram’s algorithm.

title: Adobe-Figma Deal Faces U.K. Scrutiny
description: Britain’s top competition regulator, which rejected Microsoft’s proposed acquisition of Activision, said the deal could reduce innovation and boost costs.

title: Ethics Official Owned Meta Stock While Recommending FTC Chair Recuse Herself From Meta Case
description: The Federal Trade Commission’s designated ethics official said she acted properly, but faces questions from a watchdog group.

title: Pour-Over Coffee Is a Hassle. Can a $699 Machine Make Mornings Easier?
description: The latest release from Balmuda, a trendy kitchen appliance company, is part of a growing class of coffee machines that attempt to simulate the abilities of a practiced barista at the press of a button

title: AI Law Draws Pushback From Big Brands in Europe
description: Executives from dozens of large European companies including Siemens, Heineken and Renault issued an open letter warning that rules as drafted risk driving companies and capital away from the continent.

title: New Export Curbs on Chip Technology Published by Netherlands
description: Dutch semiconductor companies will have to seek government permission before they can sell some types of chip-making equipment abroad.

title: Microsoft-Activision Hearing Set to Wrap Up as FTC Tries to Stop Deal
description: The hearing in San Francisco could decide the fate of one of tech’s largest-ever acquisitions.
